summary:
The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions on the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda (ICTR), particularly resolutions 1503 (2003) and 1534 (2004) which set out the Tribunal's completion strategy, 

Decides to allow the Secretary-General to appoint additional ad litem judges, as a temporary measure, to enable the ICTR to complete trials and conduct additional trials, 

Authorizes the appointment of up to 12 ad litem judges, temporarily exceeding the statutory maximum of 9, until 31 December 2009, 

Amends article 11, paragraph 2, of the ICTR Statute, allowing Trial Chambers to be divided into sections of 3 judges each, 

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
